tasks: Create a simple wireframe for a login form using the 8-point grid system, focusing on visual hierarchy and typography.
Write down 5 principles of Tesler's Law and explain how they apply to UI design in a short paragraph (approx. 150 words).
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system, incorporating at least 2 colors from your brand palette.
Conduct a user interview and document 3 pain points related to UI Craft & Visual Design using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework.
Create a mood board for a hypothetical product, incorporating at least 5 aesthetic principles from Laws of UX (Aesthetic-Usability Effect, Tesler’s Law, Zeigarnik Effect).
Design a simple icon set using the 8-point grid system and explain how you considered visual hierarchy and color theory.
Create a low-fidelity prototype of a hypothetical product feature, focusing on usability and user flow.
Write a short essay (approx. 250 words) explaining the concept of Product Thinking & Strategy in UX design, using examples from your own experiences or industry trends.
Design a simple visual system for a hypothetical product, incorporating at least 3 principles from Laws of UX (Aesthetic-Usability Effect, Tesler’s Law, Zeigarnik Effect).
Create a high-fidelity prototype of a hypothetical product feature, focusing on usability and user flow.
Develop a design strategy document for a real or hypothetical product, incorporating at least 5 principles from Laws of UX (Product Thinking & Strategy).

Design a comprehensive visual system for a hypothetical product, incorporating at least 3 principles from Laws of UX (Aesthetic-Usability Effect, Tesler’s Law, Zeigarnik Effect) and explaining how you applied them.

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the power to shape the user experience of products and services that impact people's lives. To unlock your full potential, focus on building a strong foundation in UX fundamentals, collaboration, and communication, while continuously honing your skills in user research, visual design, and product thinking.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Impact on UX Design
topics.summary: Learning how to apply Hick's Law to optimize navigation and reduce cognitive load will help Explorer designers improve user experience.
practice_points: Create a heuristic evaluation report for 3 existing websites using Hick's Law as a guide
Design an intuitive navigation menu with clear labels and minimal options (5-7 choices)
Conduct an A/B test to compare the impact of different button sizes on user click-through rates

topics.name: Applying Tesler’s Law to Improve Visual Hierarchy
topics.summary: Learning how to apply Tesler’s Law will help Explorer designers create more readable and scannable interfaces.
practice_points: Create a visual hierarchy exercise using 5-7 design elements (e.g., color, typography, imagery) with clear instructions on how to arrange them
Design a wireframe with a clear visual hierarchy for a fictional e-commerce website
Conduct an analysis of 3 existing websites and identify areas where Tesler’s Law can be applied to improve visual clarity

topics.name: Using the Zeigarnik Effect in UX Design
topics.summary: Learning how to apply the Zeigarnik Effect will help Explorer designers create more engaging and memorable user experiences.
practice_points: Design a task list or to-do app that incorporates the Zeigarnik Effect through uncompleted tasks and reminders
Create an interactive prototype with a countdown timer using the Zeigarnik Effect to build anticipation
Conduct an analysis of 3 existing websites and identify areas where the Zeigarnik Effect can be applied to improve user engagement

insights.detailed: The current score of 15 indicates a need to improve fundamental understanding of user experience principles, including user research, wireframing, and interaction design. This includes developing skills in creating user personas, user journeys, and usability testing.
actionable: Take an online course on UX fundamentals to learn about user-centered design
Read books and articles on UX best practices to stay updated
Join a UX community or forum to network with other designers

insights.brief: Score meaning for UI Craft & Visual Design
insights.detailed: The current score of 9 indicates a need to improve skills in visual design, including typography, color theory, and composition. This includes learning about design systems and how to create consistent visual identities.
actionable: Enroll in a course on UI design principles and visual design tools
Practice designing visually appealing interfaces using online tools or software
Study design systems and how they can be applied to real-world projects

insights.brief: Score meaning for User Research & Validation
insights.detailed: The current score of 25 indicates a solid foundation in user research methods, including user interviews, surveys, and usability testing. However, there is room for improvement in analyzing and interpreting research findings.
actionable: Take a course on qualitative data analysis to improve skills in interpreting research findings
Practice conducting user interviews and usability testing with real-world projects
Read books and articles on user research best practices to stay updated

insights.brief: Score meaning for Product Thinking & Strategy
insights.detailed: The current score of 10 indicates a need to improve skills in product thinking, including understanding customer needs, creating business models, and developing minimum viable products. This includes learning about design sprints and agile methodologies.
actionable: Enroll in a course on product management principles and design sprints
Read books and articles on product strategy and business model innovation
Join a product community or forum to network with other product managers

insights.detailed: The current score of 14 indicates a need to improve skills in collaboration and communication, including working with cross-functional teams, creating effective project plans, and facilitating meetings. This includes learning about conflict resolution and negotiation techniques.
actionable: Take a course on team management and collaboration best practices
Practice facilitating meetings and workshops using online tools or software
Read books and articles on communication strategies for designers
